title: U.S. consumer spending slows; business investment weak
text: U.S. consumer spending barely rose in August and business investment remained weak, suggesting the economy was losing momentum as trade tensions linger.

title: Wall Street opens higher as financials rise
text: U.S. stocks opened higher on Friday as financials rose but the S&P 500 and Nasdaq may still end a volatile week in the red as the shock of the launch of an impeachment investigation into President Donald Trump offsets positive cues on trade.

title: Late Inning Heroics? Stocks Hint At Friday Rally As Trade Talk Optimism On the Rise
text: Strong durable goods and hopes for progress on trade now that talks are scheduled seem to have the market in a better mood so far this morning, but we’ll see if that holds up and maybe allows stocks to finish the week on a positive note. They’re down slightly so far this week.

title: Middle East tensions are easing after the Saudi oil attack. That's pushing prices lower
text: Oil prices fell Friday on some signs that stability could return to the Middle East.

title: Wall Street Week Ahead: Data will show damage of tariffs, strong dollar on U.S. goods exporters
text: It's no longer a probability, it's a reality: the escalating U.S.-China trade war and the strengthening dollar appear to be inflicting measurable damage on U.S.

title: Stock Market Swings On Trump Impeachment, China Trade News; Nike, Micron, Peloton IPO: Weekly Review
text: The stock market was mixed this week amid a Trump impeachment inquiry and China trade news. Nike earnings, weak Micron guidance and IPO woes stood out.

title: 4 Reasons To Pedal Away From Peloton Stock
text: Peloton plunged 11% in its stock market debut. That does not make its stock a bargain.

title: Huge trade tariffs on Europe could come next week if US wins WTO dispute
text: Washington wants to hit the EU with billions in tariffs over alleged illegal state support for the European planemaker.

title: Oil drops after Iran's president said US offered to remove all sanctions in exchange for talks
text: Iranian President Hassan Rouhani claimed the U.S. offered to remove all sanctions on Iran in exchange for negotiations.

title: Shares rise as trade optimism muffles impeachment noise
text: World shares erased losses on Friday, buoyed by a wave of optimism that U.S.-China trade tensions might be easing as markets largely brushed off concerns about possible impeachment moves against U.S.

title: World shares rise as trade optimism muffles impeachment noise

title: Shares slip as U.S. political concerns temper trade optimism
text: World share markets dipped on Friday, with concerns about U.S. political developments after a whistleblower complaint against President Donald Trump denting optimism about an easing of U.S.

title: Europe Stocks Climb As U.S. Futures, Dollar Drift: Markets Wrap
text: European shares rose while U.S. futures struggled for traction and Treasuries steadied before key inflation data in the world's largest economy.

title: Oil sinks on weak China data, fading Saudi supply concerns
text: Oil prices fell on Friday after fresh Chinese economic data revived concerns of slowing economic growth, and while a faster-than-expected recovery in Saudi crude oil output this week eased concerns of major supply disruptions.

title: Negative Sentiment Turn
text: Giving up nearly all the gain from the past couple of weeks, bullish sentiment is now back to where it stood at the start of the month.

title: As Facebook and Apple encroach on finance, top banks are teaming up with younger rivals
text: Fintech partnerships give banks the chance to experiment without creating costly in-house projects.
